title: Metal Type Identification
content:
Ya'll,   
   
Anybody aware of a good reference for identifying metal type? I suppose it would be best to find out what foundry the type is coming from, no?
author: jyoung

comments.content:
Encyclopedia of Type Faces, W.P. Jaspert et al.   
American Metal Type Faces of the 20th Century, M. McGrew
Thanks. I'm assuming these titles could possibly be found at a library? Or are we talking rare...

I think we are talking 'rare' if it is like :   
Pelletteri, Giuseppe. 1963, Atlante Tipologico ; SEI, Torino.   
 [http://www.nopress.it/aldrovandi/articolo.php?art=57](http://web.archive.org/web/20060519140706/http:/www.nopress.it/aldrovandi/articolo.php?art=57)   
 the same specimen book quoted at :   
 [http://cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/nonsolusstory.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20060519140706/http:/cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/nonsolusstory.html) -   
 [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/42604.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20060519140706/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/42604.jpg)   
   
Best,   
AS

They are in print: [American Metal Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20060519140706/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0938768395/qid=1114636321/sr=1-1/ref=sr_1_1/104-3172985-4260751?v=glance&s=books) and [Encyclopedia of Typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20060519140706/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/1841881392/qid=1114636460/sr=1-3/ref=sr_1_3/104-3172985-4260751?v=glance&s=books)
Great, that'll probably work. Thanks a bunch.
